fields.description:
I've tried many different combinations to install with R 4.10 on a RHEL8 machine, including multiple versions of GCC. I am unable to install arrow with ARROW_JEMALLOC=ON. The error says I need to add an "--host" option within the configure for this step but its entirely unclear in any existing documentation where that needs to be added and what the option should be. 

 
{code:java}
Sys.setenv("ARROW_JEMALLOC" = "ON")
Sys.setenv("ARROW_MIMALLOC" = "ON")
Sys.setenv("ARROW_R_DEV" = TRUE)
Sys.setenv("ARROW_PARQUET" = "ON")
Sys.setenv("ARROW_S3" = "ON")
Sys.setenv("LIBARROW_DEBUG_DIR" = '/home/ruser/arrow79')
options(repos = c(REPO_NAME = "https://packagemanager.rstudio.com/all/__linux__/centos8/latest"))
install.packages('arrow', '/home/ruser/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.1')
{code}

comments.body:
For curl, could you try the followings and provide output of them?

{noformat}
$ mkdir -p /tmp/xxx
$ cd /tmp/xxx
$ echo "find_package(CURL REQUIRED)" > CMakeLists.txt
$ cmake .
$ echo $?
{noformat}

I figured out the issue. The Centos8 version of this binary is broken that I grabbed from here: [https://packagemanager.rstudio.com/all/__linux__/centos8/latest] which attempts: [https://packagemanager.rstudio.com/all/__linux__/centos8/latest/src/contrib/arrow_8.0.0.tar.gz]

With RHEL8, the _*ubuntu-18.04*_ version is what is needed and is actually suggested in the file in git (https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ursa-labs/arrow-r-nightly/master/linux/distro-map.csv). Then I get all the missing options vs defaulting to a minimal package.

I'm assuming whatever tries to figure out the OS has a problem. The fact that ubuntu is the only one that installs, and centos8 version fails is very misleading.

On a functional machine, or when I forced (NOT_CRAN=true), (LIBARROW_BINARY=ubuntu-18.04)
{code:java}
* installing *source* package 'arrow' ...
** package 'arrow' successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked
** using staged installation
*** Using ubuntu-18.04 binary for rhel-8
*** Successfully retrieved C++ binaries for ubuntu-18.04 

{code}
On a broken machine with NOT_CRAN=true... it would try to default to [https://packagemanager.rstudio.com/all/__linux__/centos8/latest/src/contrib/arrow_8.0.0.tar.gz]. But not in every case. Only after other R packages were installed. Not sure which ones
{code:java}
 installing *source* package 'arrow' ...
** package 'arrow' successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked
** using staged installation
*** No libarrow binary found for version 8.0.0 on redhatenterprise-8
*** Found local C++ source: 'tools/cpp'
*** Building libarrow from source
    For a faster, more complete installation, set the environment variable NOT_CRAN=true before installing {code}

Sounds like there are a few things happening here:

1. RSPM doesn't actually have a binary package for centos8. If it did, you wouldn't be compiling from source--even downloading our libarrow binary means you're still compiling the R bindings from source. That should be reported to them. https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/13211#issuecomment-1135052355 describes how.
2. "I'm assuming whatever tries to figure out the OS has a problem." That would be https://github.com/nealrichardson/distro. Could you file an issue/PR there? The readme mentions how to add an OS that's not handled correctly.
3. Whatever is causing the libarrow build to fail on your machine, which we still haven't understood.
